alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Park County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:04PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Park County through 345 PM MDT... At 303 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Guffey, or 39 miles west of Colorado Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Hail may accumulate on roadways causing hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Elevenmile Canyon Reservoir and Guffey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
